etymology.description: Depicts grain plant with two leaves -> symbolizing multiplicity and repetition -> each, every
etymology.interpretation: This character originally depicted a grain plant with two leaves emerging from the sides, symbolizing the idea of multiplicity and is used to mean 'each' or 'every' in contexts, suggesting repetition.

examples.chinese: 每个人都有机会(每個人都有機會)。
我每天练习一小时(我每天練習一小時)。
examples.english: I practice for an hour each day.

examples.chinese: 每朵花都有它的香气(每朵花都有它的香氣)。
examples.pinyin: Měi duǒ huā dōu yǒu tā de xiāngqì.
examples.english: Each flower has its own fragrance.
